explanation.text:
Explanation
Transportation refers to the activity that facilitates the physical movement of goods as well as individuals from one place to another. In business, it supports trade and industry in carrying raw materials to the place of production and distributing finished products for consumption.

text: An aspect of commerce that facilitates the distribution of products is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Extractive industries are the businesses that take raw materials, including oil, coal, gold, iron, copper, and other minerals, from the earth.

text: An activity that involves derivation of raw materials from land and sea is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Secondary production refers to the manufacturing and assembly process. It involves converting raw materials into components, for example, making plastics from oil as well as making soap from oils.

text: The art of soaping-making is an example of?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The primary production stage of the supply chain encompasses agricultural activities, aquaculture, fisheries, and similar processes resulting in raw food materials. Form the question above, fishing and gardening are the only tasks that falls under primary production

text:
Given:
i. Shoemaker
ii. Policeman
iii. Fisherman
iv. Gardener
v.Broker
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Production is a process of combining various material inputs and immaterial inputs (plans, know-how) in order to make something for consumption (the output). It is simply the conversion of raw materials into semi-finished goods or goods.

text: The process of changing the form of a new material is known as?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The long-run is a period of time in which all factors of production and costs are variable.

text: In the long run, all factors of production are?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
When businesses can improve the efficiency of the factors of production, this leads to the creation of more goods at a higher quality and perhaps a lower price.

text: The quality and quantity of production mostly depend on the?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Thrift Cooperative is a voluntary association of individuals who come together to meet their savings, credit, and insurance needs. One of the major purposes of forming these associations is to encourage saving cultures amongst its members.

text: The promotion of savings culture is a feature of a?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A certificate of incorporation is a document given by the companies' regulation agency of a country (in Nigeria's case this is the Corporate Affairs Commission – CAC) as evidence of the existence of a company, and its right to do business.

text: A document which gives a legal status to a company is the certificate of?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
One of the criteria for getting your business name registered by the corporate affairs commission is that it must be a unique and distinct name, different from an already existing business name. This means that whatever name you choose, must not conflict with that of another.

text: A proposed company may not be registered if?

options.text: the name conficits with that of another
it does not put 'limited' after its proposed name
it has no asset of its own

subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A cartel is where two or more businesses agree not to compete with each other. The businesses agree not to compete with each other. Example the OPEC

text: An example of a cartel is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Retained earnings are a portion of a company's profit that is held or retained from being distributed or paid out to investors, but rather re-invested into the business. This is one of the cheapest sources of funds for a business because it doesn't come at an extra cost. That is, the business will not be required to pay interest on the funds.

text: The cheapest source of funds available to a company is through?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Capital employed is derived by subtracting current liabilities from total assets

text: The components of capital employed in a business are?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The reserve ratio is a compulsory portion of reservable liabilities that commercial banks must hold onto, rather than lend out or invest. Simply put, it is the minimum amount of money that banks are expected to keep in their accounts, with no option of lending it or investing it.
This is done to cater to unforeseen circumstances and to ensure that banks can always meet up with their daily monetary obligations to customers without running out of money.

text: In order to prevent Liquidity in commercial banks, the central banks uses?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A domiciliary account is a special kind of bank account that allows you to receive and make payments in foreign currencies.

text: An account maintained with a commercial bank for the purpose of foreign exchange transaction is the?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
When a company sells on credit, it attracts new customers who would otherwise not buy from the company. This leads to increased sales volume

text: A trader who gives credit stands to enjoy?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A bull market is the condition of a financial market in which prices are rising or are expected to rise. A stock market player who buys securities in the hope that the prices will rise in the future is called a bull.

text: A person who buys new issues with a view of reselling at a higher price in the near future is referred to as a?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Chain stores are a group of numerous stores usually retail stores, having the same ownership and selling the same lines of goods.

text: A type of retail trade where a group of similar stores which is owned by a firm operates in different locations is a?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A bonded warehouse is a customs-controlled warehouse for the retention of imported goods until the duty owed is paid.

text: A warehouse which is used to store goods whose customs duty is not yet paid is a?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The balance of payments (BOP) is a statement of all transactions made between people in one country and the rest of the world over a defined period of time. It consists of current and capital items.
Current items consist of the inflow and outflow of goods and services between countries, including all the receipts and payments made with respect to raw materials and manufactured goods. While capital transactions include the purchase and sale of assets (non-financial) like land and properties.

text: Balance of payments is made up of?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Globalization is the process by which businesses or other organizations are able to move and exchange human resources, goods, and services, capital, technologies or cultural practices all over the planet. Globalization promotes and increases interactions between different regions and populations around the globe.

text: Most of the barriers to international trade have been eliminated through?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A price list is simply a list giving the prices of items for sale.

text: A document sent by a seller to inform a buyer about the prices of goods is the?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Free on Board (FOB) is a shipment term used to indicate whether the seller or the buyer is responsible for goods that are damaged or destroyed during shipping. In this instance, it means that the buyer is liable for the insurance and transportation of the goods while on transit

text: When 'FOB' is written on a document, it implies that the buyer bears the?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
To answer this question we need to understand the three parties to a cheque.
The drawer: The drawer is the bank account owner whose signature appears on the cheque.
The drawee: The drawee of a check is the banker/bank.
The payee: The payee is the person who receives money from the bank. He is the party in favor of whom the cheque is issued.
A crossed cheque is a cheque that can only be paid into the bank account of the payee, and cannot be cashed directly at the counter of the bank. The effect of crossing a cheque ‘not negotiable’ is to warn the transferee (the payee in this case) that his or her title is subject to all prior defects in the title. Since cheques are only issued to current account holders it's safe to say that the money will have to be paid to the current account of the payee.

text: A crossed cheque with the inscription 'not negotiable' must be paid into the?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A trade association is a business association founded and funded by businesses that operate in a specific industry for the benefit of its members and to to promote their common interests.

text: The pooling of business information for the benefit of members is a major function of a?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines, and Agriculture is an organization for all Nigerian state and related Chambers of Commerce of Nigeria. The organization's goal is to further the interests of businesses in the country.

text: An association to which all chambers of commerce in Nigeria are affiliated is the?

options.text: National Association of Chambers of commerce, industry, Mines and Agriculture
Nigeria Association of Chambers of commerce, industry, Mines and Agriculture

Noise is one of the most common barriers to communication. It is any persistent or random disturbance that reduces, obscures, or confuses the clarity of a message.

Explanation
Cultural tourism is the act of travelers visiting particular destinations in order to experience and learn about a particular culture. This can include many activities such as; attending events and festivals, visiting museums to see historical artifacts, and tasting the local food and drinks.

text: A historical building is a feature of?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
In insurance, a premium is the amount of money an individual or business must pay for an insurance policy.

text: The sum of money paid by a policy-holder to an insurer is referred to as?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Uninsurable risks are risks that cannot be covered because they are either too probable, too catastrophic, and costly to cover. Risks whose peril cannot be predicted nor estimated are also considered non-insurable.
Events such as war, terrorism, and radioactive contamination are also considered non-insurable.

text: An example of a non-insurable risk is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The control unit of the central processing unit regulates and integrates the operations of the computer. It directs the flow of data between the CPU and the other devices.

text: The coordinating section of the central processing unit that manages the flow of data is the?
subject: COMMERCE

Explanation
A contract is a legally binding promise made between at least 2 parties in order to fulfill an obligation in exchange for something of value.

Explanation
Indemnification simply means the protection against a loss or other financial burden. Just like the question has explained, when an employee incurs financial expenses while adjudicating his/her duties, the employer is expected to indemnify or compensate the employee for the loss or amount spent.

text: When an employee incurs expenses while executing his normal duty, the employer is responsible for his?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Bureau of Public Enterprises - BPE is charged with the overall responsibility of implementing the Nigerian policy on privatization and commercialization.

text: The body charged with divesting government interests in public enterprises is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Privatization occurs when a government-owned business, operation, or property becomes owned by a private, non-government party.

text: The practice whereby government relinquishes its ownership interest in a public enterprises is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
In business, technology provides a faster, more convenient, and more efficient way of performing business transactions. With this, old products and services become outdated and obsolete to meet demand when the firms do not upgrade to emerging technologies.

text: A factor in a business environment which increases the rate of product obsolescence is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Social responsibility in business means that businesses should act in a manner that benefits society, by adopting policies that promote the well-being of society and the environment while lessening negative impacts on them.

text: Which of the following is a form of social responsibility of a business?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
A central processing unit (CPU) is the electronic circuitry within a computer that carries out the instructions of a computer program by performing the basic arithmetic, logical, control and input/output (I/O) operations specified by the instructions.

text: A computer component that decodes and interprets instructions and also directs program implementation is?
subject: COMMERCE

explanation.text:
Explanation
MS Excel uses a collection of cells arranged into rows and columns to organize and manipulate financial or arithmetic data. It is typically used to organize data and perform financial analysis. It is used across all business functions and at companies from small to large.

text: Which software program can be used to generate financial reports from a company's client list?
subject: COMMERCE
